channel.title: Czar and Delta Sources
channel.description:
Hey guys! I have been gone for a while now and have just started to get back into Runescape, so I want to get back into Mopar too. I am also taking a Java programming class at school right now, which means that I can program a Mopar server for a grade.
I was going through some old files of mine, and found some old sources. Mainly Delta and Czar sources. I want to try to develope a new kind of source from one of these (probably Czar because I like it better). I am willing to learn anything needed to get it where it needs to be, but I am having some troubles with the client. I can't find a client that supports all of the new silab items.
I found a few clients but they always ended up on Megaupload, which was recently shut down by the US Government. So I am stuck. I know I can add my own sprites and such, but I don't know where to get them from and how to do it.
If you all can help me either find a guide to adding sprites or finding a client with all of the silab sprites I would greatly appreciate it!
Thanks for everything! I am sooo glad to be back!

I guess ill just have to make one.

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Run either of them for the first time, I don’t think either of them changed how RuneSource started up, so all you would need to still do is add the arguments into your IDE. I think it would go Host Port Cycle (127.0.0.01 43594 600). I am not to sure how you set arguments in Eclipse so you’re on your own with that.

item.title: Czar and Delta Sources
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:21, topic:430153”]Either way it seems Czar may not be the best one for you to use though unless you are keen on it however if your going to be using it for your course you can’t just stop with it midway, you’ll need to use it throughout the duration of the course.

Pi isn’t considered very good compared to a few other basis but its generally decent it still has the capabilities of other basis however its not as stable and needs some work done in certain area’s. The performance will never be as good as Hyperion without a loooot of work done to it making it almost completely different however its pretty easy to use in comparison to the other making it a popular choice for ‘leaching’ which has made its reputation even worse.
Also, good luck :).[/quote]

if you think of it Hyperion isn’t the greatest either, the cons of Hyperion is the highly abstracted design which by default will slow the server down since the content you do add will have to go through so many sets to even be processed, on the other hand a far less abstracted design like RuneSource will have far more performance then Hyperion or Apollo, but suffers from the WinterLove design which means you will have to add a lot of patch code to fix problems up, things that wouldn’t need to be patched up like in a design with Hyperion or Apollo. So really it’s up to what the person is looking for, from a programmers perspective a Hyperion or Apollo design would be a better choose as content development would be easier, from a less knowledgeable programmer or a person who uses a WinterLove design server, RuneSource would appeal more to them, since a lot of the people who started Java programming here started on the WinterLove base meaning they will find it easier to program then a Hyperion or Apollo server.

b b0yz 4:

I am up for using any source, except Hyperion - RuneSource - Apollo. They seem annoying. I haven’t been able to find a clean/good starting source for me because I want to learn a lot and want to do a lot to the actual source. I know it is going to be a lot of work, but I am up for it.

All three of those servers are as clean as you can get… If you want to learn more then I suggest you try each of them, using them all will for one, teach you about different design approaches to the RuneScape protocol and Java in general, and can also teach you the basics and even more higher level things such as concurrency.

Read full topic

item.title: Czar and Delta Sources
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Either way it seems Czar may not be the best one for you to use though unless you are keen on it however if your going to be using it for your course you can’t just stop with it midway, you’ll need to use it throughout the duration of the course.

Pi isn’t considered very good compared to a few other basis but its generally decent it still has the capabilities of other basis however its not as stable and needs some work done in certain area’s. The performance will never be as good as Hyperion without a loooot of work done to it making it almost completely different however its pretty easy to use in comparison to the other making it a popular choice for ‘leaching’ which has made its reputation even worse.
Also, good luck :).

Read full topic
